**Priority**: [Critical/High/Medium/Low]  
**Severity**: [Critical/High/Medium/Low]  
**Status**: [New/Open/In Progress/Resolved/Closed/Reopened]  

---

## Bug History
| Date | Status | Action | Updated By | Comments |
|------|--------|--------|------------|----------|
| [Date] | New | Bug Reported | [Tester] | Initial bug report |
| [Date] | Open | Assigned | [Manager] | Assigned to developer |
| [Date] | In Progress | Investigation Started | [Developer] | Started investigation |
| [Date] | Resolved | Fix Implemented | [Developer] | Fix deployed to test environment |
| [Date] | Closed | Verified | [Tester] | Bug fix verified and closed |

---

## Priority and Severity Guidelines

### Priority Levels
- **Critical**: Blocks testing or major functionality
- **High**: Important feature affected, workaround available
- **Medium**: Minor feature affected, easy workaround
- **Low**: Cosmetic issue, no functional impact

### Severity Levels
- **Critical**: System crash, data loss, security vulnerability
- **High**: Major functionality broken, no workaround
- **Medium**: Minor functionality affected, workaround exists
- **Low**: Cosmetic issue, typos, minor UI problems

---

## Template Usage Instructions
1. Copy this template for each new bug report
2. Fill in all applicable sections completely
3. Attach screenshots and evidence files
4. Use clear, descriptive titles
5. Provide detailed steps to reproduce
6. Update status as bug progresses through workflow
7. Include all relevant environment details
8. Verify bug fix before closing
